definition: abbr. for Kurdistan Workers' Party 庫爾德工人黨|库尔德工人党[Ku4 er3 de2 Gong1 ren2 dang3]

sentences.english: "Labour won't stand by and let this continue, " David Cunliffe said.
sentences.chinese: 工黨不會坐視不管，任由這種情形持續。

sentences.english: Labour says…The process followed by National has been anti-democratic.
sentences.chinese: 工黨認爲，由國家黨主導的這個立法過程是反民主的。

sentences.english: This has meant disappointments and compromises that are now causing the party harm.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着失望與妥協現在正造成工黨的傷害。

sentences.english: The party was established to represent the interests of workers and trade unionists.
sentences.chinese: 工黨的成立宗旨是代表工人階級和行業工會的利益。

sentences.english: He thundered against the policies of the Labour Government.
sentences.chinese: 他猛烈抨擊工黨政府的政策。

sentences.english: Mr. Alexander launched a scathing attack on Labour's campaign tactics.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大先生對工黨的競選策略發起猛烈進攻。

sentences.english: They were determined to win the seat back from Labor.
sentences.chinese: 他們決心從工黨手裏重新奪得這個議席。

sentences.english: Exit polls in Norway’s general elections suggest the Labor-led coalition has been re-elected.
sentences.chinese: 挪威大選民意調查顯示，工黨領導的聯盟再次當選。

sentences.english: Waterstone's, like New Labour, is emblematic of a changing Britain.
sentences.chinese: 水石書店和新工黨一樣都反映着正經歷變動的英國。

sentences.english: During this year's election as Labour MP Labour Party candidate against Chet.
sentences.chinese: 今年大選期間工黨禁止切特作爲工黨議員參選。

sentences.english: During this year's election as Labour MP Labour Party candidate against Chet.
sentences.chinese: 今年大選期間工黨禁止切特作爲工黨議員參選。

sentences.english: Two left wingers have been put forward for the Labour Party's National Executive.
sentences.chinese: 成員被提名爲工黨全國執行委員會的委員。

sentences.english: That will make sloganeering about Labour's commitment to "investment" even hollower than before.
sentences.chinese: 這將會使得工黨關於“投資”的承諾比以前更加空洞。

sentences.english: The unions are also using their muscle to install placemen as Labour parliamentary candidates.
sentences.chinese: 作爲工黨議會侯選人，工會也正在佈署方案。

sentences.english: Tuition fees were introduced by the Labour government and first paid by students in 1998.
sentences.chinese: 英國自1998年工黨執政期間開始實行大學收費制。

sentences.english: Officials of the Labor Party and the Conservative Party say they support the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 目前英國工黨和保守黨都已有官員表示支持這一提案。

definition: to take part in an election/to run for office
